#Text=Kurama
#Text=Kurama is in Kyoto prefecture , Japan .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The small , quiet village of Kurama lies a short distance north from Kyoto .
#Text=Tourists come to Kurama mostly because of the onsen ( Japanese natural hot spring ) , which is the closest one from the popular tourist destination of Kyoto .
#Text=The Buddhist temple of Kurama-dera will also draw some attention from the visitors .
#Text=Kurama will make a good daytrip destination from Kyoto - you will have time to visit both the onsen and the temple easily during one day .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Kurama is connected to Kyoto with Eizan Railway .
#Text=Trip from Kyoto 's Demachi-Yanagi station costs ¥ 420 and takes a little more than half an hour .
#Text=Some like to stop one station earlier at Kibune and walk to Kurama along a beautiful hiking trail , which passes the Buddhist temple of Kurama .
#Text=The train will pass some quite beautiful scenery before arriving at Kurama , so get a window seat and keep your eyes open in the train .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Kurama is a rather small rural village , you can reach most of the interesting sights by foot .
#Text=See
#Text=Kuramadera Temple .
#Text=A Buddhist temple overlooking the valley from the hills .
#Text=There is an elevated railway from the village to the hills , but in order to see all the temples you have to walk either up or down .
#Text=If you have been doing temple-hopping in Kyoto , Kurama-dera will be a pleasant surprise - even during the peak season , it does n't get crowded here .

#Text=If you like a 30 minute to 1 hour hike , it also provides a scenic mountain experience for only 200 yen that is much more expansive than the very quick and expensive visits to many of the World Heritage temples ringing Kyoto .
#Text=Kibune Shrine .
#Text=Fire Festival
#Text=This festival is held every year in October .
#Text=It 's a fascinating festival that few would have likely have seen in their home countries .
#Text=The date tends to be around the 20th but might change from year to year .
#Text=Find out when it is and go early for the area gets very congested the closer to dusk it gets .
#Text=A tip for the return home is to walk down the road to the next station .
#Text=It 's a bit easier to get on the train there and is a nice walk downhill .
#Text=Do
#Text=Kurama
#Text=onsen
#Text=or hot spring is located just a short walk from the station .
#Text=There 's also a free shuttle bus going every now and then , but you 're recommended to take the walk ( at least on the way back , which is downhill ) and see some Japanese countryside .
#Text=There are both inside and outside baths , but if the weather permits do take the outside bath ( rotenburo ) .
#Text=Lying in the hot water , while admiring the green and hilly scenery is wonderfully relaxing .
#Text=There are separate pools for men and women .
#Text=Eat
#Text=There are several noodle shops in the vicinity of the Kurama station .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=You can also find more accommodation from the nearby village of Kibune .
#Text=Kurama onsen .
#Text=They have also accommodation available .
#Text=Usage of both indoor and outdoor baths are included .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Kyoto
#Text=Mount Hiei
